title: Motorcycle prostitution in Burkina Faso | METROPOLIS
description:
Grace in Burkina Faso makes a good living with 'the oldest profession in the world' thanks to her motorcycle. It gives her prestige and it pays a lot better. 

Metropolis is a video project by Dutch broadcast organizations HUMAN and VPRO, that started in 2008. Metropolis is made by a global collective of young filmmakers and TV producers, reporting on remarkable stories from their own country or city.

More videos and full episodes on http://www.human.nl/metropolis

title: Yaaba
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

Living in a small West African village are the boy Bila and his girl friend Nopoko. Their days are spent on the lush savannah. As time passes by, a tension begins to brews in the nearby village. A pretty woman married to an alcoholic is having an shameless affair!

FLOBY est poli de musique. TrÃ¨s jeune, il ne tombera pas loin de son arbre : sa grand-mÃ¨re griotte a laissÃ© en lui des graines qui, de plus en plus produits des forets, des fruits et de l'ombre. Cette influence prend sons sens en l'artiste dans l'acquisition du rythme, de la rhÃ©torique, dans , aussi, l'enracinement dans sa culture et essence profonde. title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

Au Burkina Faso, la confrÃ©rie initiatique des chasseurs sÃ©noufo perpÃ©tue des traditions millÃ©naires. Elle prÃªche la libertÃ©, lâ€™Ã©galitÃ©, la fraternitÃ© et lâ€™entente entre tous les hommes, sans distinction de classe, de naissance, de croyance ni dâ€™origine. Si le fusil sâ€™est aujourdâ€™hui substituÃ© Ã  lâ€™arc, le rapport de force existant entre lâ€™homme et lâ€™animal nâ€™en a pas pour autant Ã©tÃ© rompu. Lorsquâ€™il expire, le gibier libÃ¨re une force vengeresse, le nyama, qui poursuit le chasseur sa vie durant. Gris-gris, plantes et priÃ¨res magiques, mais aussi musique, danses et pantomimes lâ€™aideront Ã  lâ€™exorciser et Ã  lâ€™apprivoiser. Des chantres, armÃ©s de leur seule parole et de leur harpe-luth, ont la charge de transmettre la connaissance et de louanger les hommes les plus valeureux.

title: Tilai
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

Saga returns to his village after an absence of many years, only to discover that his beloved Nogma has been wed to his father.

title: Delwende
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

In Burkina Faso, a country confronted with poverty and archaic traditions, ancestral customs are regarded as laws. In the countryside, unexplained deaths are often attributed to 'soul eaters', women with occult and malignant powers whom villagers hold responsible for these disappearances. They are outcast and become the scapegoats of an entire community.

title: BURKINABE - Official Trailer (HD)
description:
Teka Films in collaboration with Goethe-Institut Ouagadougou, presents BURKINABE. The project is a collaboration between production, cast and crew from South African and Burkina Faso respectively. The film is a description of African youth battling with the tension between our rural roots and our urban realities. 

OUT JUNE 21 2019

"YOUR BODY MAY LEAVE HOME, BUT NEVER YOUR SPIRIT."

Mariam, returns to Burkina Faso after having left as a young child who was adopted and sent out of the country to South Africa, where she always felt alien. She returns as an ailing young adult to the land of her birth on a journey of self discovery, to spend her last days in the land of her forefathers. She does not know the language, culture, or norms. She is on a quest to reconnect with her family and her roots. While trying to figure out how to get to her native village, she encounters and befriends a charismatic bike messenger/taxi driver, Moussa, who volunteers to take her South, claiming good knowledge of the country and the exact place of her village. A city slicker bike messenger, Moussa, is living a fast paced life in the city. His life is lonely as the debt is building up and he is estranged from his family living in a remote village. Outwardly Moussa seems in control, hiding behind his charm, charisma and style. Moussa grows increasingly paranoid in Ouagadougou as his debts mount up. He needs to get out. Moussa and Mariam take to the open road on a journey of self discovery. 


Written & Directed By: Nthato Mokgata & Carla Fonseca

Cast: 
Carla Fonseca
Dramane Ouedraogo
Josiane Yeri Hien
Christ Nathan Jason Mbaide

Music by Salif Diarra; Chobolo Manyelo; Nthato Mokgata

#burkinabemovie #africanfilm #indiefilm #storytelling #Tekafilms

title: Burkina Faso : The Traditional Dance of the Mossi Peopleï¼šThe Warba Dance
channel: Africa Fixer : Filming in Africa : Field Producer
description:
A traditional dance of the Mossi people of Burkina Faso: the Warba Dance.
Footage from an Africa fixer, a television producer working all over Africa. To see our collection of photos from our shoots in Burkina Faso,  go here: https://www.excelman.jpn.com/en/galer...
The Mossi are a Gur ethnic group native to modern Burkina Faso, primarily the Volta River basin. The Mossi are the largest ethnic group in Burkina Faso, constituting 52% of the population, or about 11.1 million people. The other 48% of Burkina Faso's population is composed of more than 60 ethnic groups, mainly the Gurunsi, Senufo, Lobi, Bobo and Fulani. The Mossi speak the MÃ²orÃ© language. 
 According to Mossi mythology, the Mosi royal family was founded by a king named Ouedraogo, born to a Dagomba princess and a Mande hunter in what is now northern Ghana. 
According to historical accounts, the Mossi kingdom rose in this region in the mid-15th century with Tengodogo as its capital, and its powerful cavalry kept it independent from the Mali Empire and the Kingdom of Songai, which were at the height of their power at the time. After a while, Northern Mossi, with Ouagadougou as their capital, became independent from Southern Mosi, with Tengodogo as its capital, and were divided into three independent states, each maintaining its independence until the 19th century. A ethnic group living in Burkina Faso (formerly Haute-Volta), in a savanna region in the interior of West Africa. The population is about 2 million.

title: Delwende
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

In Burkina Faso, a country confronted with poverty and archaic traditions, ancestral customs are regarded as laws. In the countryside, unexplained deaths are often attributed to 'soul eaters', women with occult and malignant powers whom villagers hold responsible for these disappearances. They are outcast and become the scapegoats of an entire community.

Burkina Faso Army Carries Out Operations
description:
Burkinabe troops carried out jihadist hunting operations through the first half of November near Burkina Fasoâ€™s border with Mali.
â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“
READ MORE: The Burkina Faso army said, Sunday, November 17,  it had killed 32 "terrorists" in two operations in the north of the country after an attack on a patrol.
 
The impoverished and politically fragile Sahel country has been struggling to quell a rising jihadist revolt that has claimed hundreds of lives since early 2015.
 
The country's badly equipped, poorly trained and underfunded security forces have been unable to stem the violence, which has intensified throughout 2019 to become almost daily.
 
The Sahel region, including Burkina Faso's neighbors Mali and Niger, has been afflicted by the violence despite the presence of the regional G5 Sahel force as well as French and U.S. troops.
â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“â€“

title: Un film plaidoyer pour les prisonniers du Burkina Faso
description:
Au regard des violations multiples et multiformes des droits des dÃ©tenus dans les prisons au Burkina Faso, l'Association Semfilms-Burkina, en partenariat avec le Mouvement BurkinabÃ© des Droits de l'Homme et des Peuples (MBDHP), a initiÃ© un projet de sensibilisation sur les thÃ©matiques spÃ©cifiques de l'humanisation des conditions de dÃ©tention, l'interdiction de la torture et les autres peines ou traitements cruels, inhumains ou dÃ©gradants.

Ce projet vise Ã  couvrir l'ensemble des quarante cinq (45) provinces du pays et porte sur les Ã©lÃ©ments suivants:

- Des projections du film Â« Une vie de cachot Â»
- Des modules de formation sur les normes internes et internationales de la dÃ©tention 
- L'interpellation du gouvernement sur la nÃ©cessitÃ© d'adopter une loi interne dÃ©finissant et rÃ©primant les actes de torture et les pratiques assimilÃ©es.

Ce reportage suit l'Ã©quipe de projection dans 2 localitÃ©s, notamment Sapouy et LÃ©o.

Akouna Farma est un vÃ©ritable auteur-compositeur-interprÃ¨te traditionnel. Il vit dans le dernier petit royaume du Burkina Faso : le royaume gan. HandicapÃ© par sa cÃ©citÃ©, il nâ€™a appris ni Ã  lire ni Ã  Ã©crire. Sa connaissance, sa crÃ©ation, passent par lâ€™oralitÃ©. Il se dÃ©place seul avec sa harpe sur de longues distance Ã  travers les pistes de brousse pour aller animer fÃªtes et cÃ©rÃ©monies.
AdulÃ© dans tout le pays gan, sa prÃ©sence est un gage de rÃ©ussite des festivitÃ©s. Si sa musique est imprÃ©gnÃ©e de la tradition ancienne, les paroles de ses chants puisent Ã  la fois dans son vÃ©cu et dans les problÃ©matiques contemporaines, telles le SIDA et lâ€™immigration. Le roi tÃ©moigne de lâ€™importance de la musique dans toutes les activitÃ©s profanes et religieuses de son royaume. Mais Akouna Farma nâ€™est pas seulement harpisteâ€¦

title: Africa's largest film festival kicks off in Burkina Faso
description:
15,000 people, including cinema celebrities from Nigeria, Senegal and Ivory Coast are expected in Ouagadougou for FESPACO, Africa's biggest film festival that was launched in 1969. This year's theme is "African cinema and culture of peace".

title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

title: NON LOTI Film BurkinabeÌ€ reÌaliseÌ par Abdoul BAGUE
BRAVO, BURKINA! Trailer â€“ 2023 New African Film Festival
description:
BRAVO, BURKINA! 
Sun, March 19, 7:00 p.m.; Thurs, March 23, 7:00 p.m. 
 
Filmmaker and designer WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ© â€” whose fashion designs appear in Marvel's BLACK PANTHER films â€” crafts this imaginative debut feature about a BurkinabÃ¨ boy who migrates to Italy and later discovers a way to go back in time and regain what he lost. A multidimensional exploration of love and migration, this poetic story bends time to explore the meaning of existing in two states â€” both coming and going, running away and running toward. From the community in Burkina Faso to the two central protagonists walking the streets of an Italian village, OyÃ©jidÃ©'s characters exude humanity and confidence. OyÃ©jidÃ© is invested in evolving the narrative of migrants, leveraging his background in fashion to assert his characters' dignity and fullness. Direct confrontations with the camera lure viewers in while an evocative score guides them through a dreamy, mystical journey. A lyrical experience and one that flows beyond the frame, BRAVO, BURKINA! is a daring invitation to imagine what could be. (Note adapted from Sundance Film Festival.) Official Selection, 2023 Sundance Film Festival. DIR/SCR/PROD WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ©; PROD Giulia Alagna, Heather Barnes. U.S., 2023, color, 64 min. In Moore and Italian with English subtitles. NOT RATED

title: FOCUS - Chute de Blaise CompoarÃ© : retour sur la rÃ©volution Ã©clair du Burkina Faso
description:
Blaise CompaorÃ© a Ã©tÃ© poussÃ© vers la sortie le 31 octobre aprÃ¨s 27 ans de rÃ¨gne au Burkina Faso. Aujourd'hui, alors que des discussions sont en cours pour organiser la transition burkinabÃ¨, France 24 revient sur les jours qui ont prÃ©cipitÃ© cette chute. Reportage.
C'Ã©tait il y a tout juste une semaine. Le 31 octobre, Blaise CompaorÃ© abandonnait le pouvoir aprÃ¨s 27 ans de rÃ¨gne sans partage sur le Burkina Faso. En seulement 48 heures, la foule des jeunes manifestants burkinabÃ¨ a prÃ©cipitÃ© la chute dâ€™un prÃ©sident qui comptait se maintenir au pouvoir en modifiant la Constitution du pays. Toute une gÃ©nÃ©ration de BurkinabÃ¨ n'avait jamais connu un autre dirigeant : au Burkina Faso, 60% de la population a moins de 25 ans.
Avec le dÃ©part soudain de Blaise CompaorÃ©, c'est l'une des derniÃ¨res figures de la FranÃ§afrique qui disparaÃ®t. L'ex-prÃ©sident Ã©tait devenu un homme incontournable en Afrique, le mÃ©diateur de nombreuses crises. Retour sur ces jours oÃ¹ tout a basculÃ© avec nos envoyÃ©s spÃ©ciaux Ã  Ouagadougou, Jonathan Walsh, Arnaud Froger et Anna Sylvestre-Treiner.

', 'You donâ€™t need funding from anyone African people just make it for African audiences and they will pay for it. Viva la mama Africa.', 'African filmmakers struggle to find funding because the majority of even the best stories fail to turn a true profit. Mostly this is due to the rampant piracy of their movies. You can find DVDs of African movies at any small store for $1 to $4, all pirated copies of the original and most of them are also available for free online.', 'The Land of Thomas Sankara ! ', 'Who has seen a Senegalese Road film called Touki Bouki (1973) by Diop Mambety.', 'Piracy also killed this industry ! title: Groovin'Poulp au Burkina Faso - Teaser Film
description:
Les aventures d'un groupe de jazz, pas tout Ã  fait comme les autres, venues dans le cadre d'un Ã©change culturel musicale Ã  l'occasion de Jazz Ã  Ouaga 2013.Burkina Faso
Composition du groovin':
Yann Trenel tuba
Aldric Plisson batterie
Felix Edouard trombone
Merwan Djane basse electrique
David Georges guitare electrique
Romain Maitrot trompette/bugle
Robin Limoge clarinette/saxophone soprano
Stephane Maitrot saxophone alto et baryton
extrait jazz Ã  couches:
Cet orchestre rÃ©unissant huit personnalitÃ©s autour de leurs compositions et leurs arrangements, du jazz ouvert et progressif puisant dans le funk et le rock.
Une des forces de cette formation est la grande variÃ©tÃ© de parcours, d'expÃ©rience et d'univers de chacun de ses musiciens. Par leurs compositions originales et leurs Ã©nergies complÃ©mentaires, ils parviennent Ã  projeter l'image d'un vrai collectif dans leurs prestations musicales et scÃ©niques, construisant une rÃ©elle identitÃ© Ã  leur groupe.

La dÃ©marche musicale du Groovin' Poulp reste ancrÃ©e dans la culture du jazz et de l'improvisation, l'influence du rock est perceptible dans les arrangements et la diversitÃ©s des ambiances musicales dÃ©veloppÃ©es. La section rythmique a une place prÃ©pondÃ©rante car la musique du Groovin' Poulp recherche l'Ã©nergie physique du funk.

title: Burkina Faso honours legendary film-maker Idrissa Ouedraogo
description:
Burkina Faso, film lovers and movie buffs have gathered to remember the work of the legendary film-maker Idrissa Ouedraogo. He died on Sunday at the age of 64, from an undisclosed illness. Over his prolific career, Ouedraogo made more than 40 films and won several international awards  including the Grand Prize at the 1990 Cannes Film Festival.

title: BurkinabÃ¨ Rising: the Art of Resistance in Burkina Faso | Documentary Trailer
description:
A small landlocked country in West Africa, Burkina Faso is home to a vibrant community of artists, musicians, & engaged citizens who carry on the revolutionary spirit of Thomas Sankara, killed in a coup d'Ã©tat led by his best friend and advisor Blaise CompaorÃ©, who then ruled the country as an autocrat for 27 years, til a massive popular insurrection led to his removal. Today, the spirit of resistance and political change is mightier than ever and it permeates every aspect of the BurkinabÃ¨ life. It is an inspiration, not only to Africa, but to the rest of the world.

title: BRAVO, BURKINA! Trailer â€“ 2023 New African Film Festival
description:
BRAVO, BURKINA! 
Sun, March 19, 7:00 p.m.; Thurs, March 23, 7:00 p.m. 
 
Filmmaker and designer WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ© â€” whose fashion designs appear in Marvel's BLACK PANTHER films â€” crafts this imaginative debut feature about a BurkinabÃ¨ boy who migrates to Italy and later discovers a way to go back in time and regain what he lost. A multidimensional exploration of love and migration, this poetic story bends time to explore the meaning of existing in two states â€” both coming and going, running away and running toward. From the community in Burkina Faso to the two central protagonists walking the streets of an Italian village, OyÃ©jidÃ©'s characters exude humanity and confidence. OyÃ©jidÃ© is invested in evolving the narrative of migrants, leveraging his background in fashion to assert his characters' dignity and fullness. Direct confrontations with the camera lure viewers in while an evocative score guides them through a dreamy, mystical journey. A lyrical experience and one that flows beyond the frame, BRAVO, BURKINA! is a daring invitation to imagine what could be. (Note adapted from Sundance Film Festival.) Official Selection, 2023 Sundance Film Festival. DIR/SCR/PROD WalÃ© OyÃ©jidÃ©; PROD Giulia Alagna, Heather Barnes. U.S., 2023, color, 64 min. In Moore and Italian with English subtitles. NOT RATED 
 
For the full lineup and to purchase tickets and passes, visit: https://bit.ly/NewAfricanFF2023
 
CONNECT WITH AFI SILVER: http://AFI.com/Silver  
Twitter: @AFISilver  
FB & IG: @afisilvertheatre  
Podcast: bit.ly/SilverStreams  
 
#NewAfricanFilmFestival #AFISilverTheatre #FilmFestival #AfricanCinema

title: Yaaba
description:
Download and Stream the full movie at www.africanfilmlibrary.com

Living in a small West African village are the boy Bila and his girl friend Nopoko. Their days are spent on the lush savannah. As time passes by, a tension begins to brews in the nearby village. A pretty woman married to an alcoholic is having an shameless affair!

title: Burkina Faso - A Short Film
description:
A short film inspired from our travels to Burkina Faso, Africa while filming documentaries for A Better Life Foundation.

Directed, shot, and edited by Jacopo Campaiola for SmashWerks Films.

https://www.smashwerksfilms.com/

Check out A Better Life Foundation and see how you can help:
http://www.ablfusa.net/

title: WaterAid case study film: Burkina Faso
description:
Short case study film made for charity WaterAid, looking at the live of people in Burkina Faso living without access to clean, safe drinking water.

Film shot and edited: Adam Beasley
Film produced: Beth Jepson
comments: ['guwtg']

Entre amertume, dÃ©solation et dÃ©sir de vengeance, Sira, qui va devoir assumer quâ€™elle est enceinte de son agresseur, dÃ©cide de tout faire pour dÃ©jouer les plans macabres des terroristes, tandis que sans quâ€™elle ne le sache son fiancÃ© est parti Ã  sa rechercheâ€¦ Trois gÃ©nÃ©rations de femmes se rÃ©vÃ¨lent aux cÃ´tÃ©s de Sira : Aissatou, sa mÃ¨re, KÃ©mi adolescente kidnappÃ©e, sÃ©questrÃ©e comme esclave sexuelle.

title: MASSOUD!, un film de Emmanuel Rotoubam MbaÃ¯dÃ© (Burkina Faso)
channel: L'AFRIQUE FAIT SON CINEMA, FESTIVAL DURABLE
description:
Massoud, a young and open-minded student works as a tourist guide in his spare time. He is passionate about culture and art. He is the only son of Barkaye, a respected and tolerant Imam of a small village community in the Sahel region.

His life will be turned upside down by the daily injustices he sees in his native region. The insecurity is getting out of hand. The straw that broke the camelâ€™s back will be the tragic killing of a close friend by the security forces. Little by little, Massoud gets radicalized and his discourse changes. His love affair with Flora, a journalist who came from Europe to investigate terrorism in the Sahel takes a hit, because of his growing interest in radical teachings. Massoud ends up joining a terrorist movement. The two lovers lose all contact, until the day he discovers Flora, kidnapped and jailed in one of the terrorist camp's cells along with other European nationals.

Day after day, attacks against civilians and security forces are organized and perpetrated by the terrorist leader and his henchmen. Under the cover of Islamism, the latter maintains various traffics with the help of Pascal, a European adventurer and former member of the special services. Pascal happens to find out that Flora, the journalist, is his natural daughter whom he conceived during one of his missions in the Sahel.

Paranoid and malicious, the terrorist leader Abdoulaye suspects Massoud's father of providing information to the security forces. He doesn't like the moderate speech of the imam who condemns in his sermons the attacks and the recruitment of young terrorists. The imam is a true advocate of tolerance, and gets more and more in the way of the radical terror movements.
One day, Abdoulaye decides to carry out an attack on the mosque and eliminate the moderate imam. It is to Massoud that he entrusts this task to eliminate his father.

Will Massoud accomplish his mission?

title: Film en langue MoorÃ¨ : Mariage forcÃ© et SIDA (Global Dialogues)
description:
Global Dialogues. Un film en langue MoorÃ¨ de FANTA NACRO.  L'histoire : Quand le riche Babacar demande Ã  Arouna la main de sa fille, Arouna est ravi. Plus tard, seul avec sa conscience, Arouna se rappelle quelques faits inquiÃ©tants sur Babacar: ses maintes maÃ®tresses, le fait qu'il ne prend pas le SIDA au sÃ©rieux. Mais est-ce que son inquiÃ©tude pour le bien-Ãªtre de sa fille l'emportera sur l'attrait des choses matÃ©rielles qu'offre Babacar? RÃ©alisÃ© par Fanta RÃ©gina Nacro ; basÃ© sur une idÃ©e  originale de Haby Fall, 20 ans, SÃ©nÃ©gal, et de son Ã©quipe. Un film de la collection SCENARIOS D'AFRIQUE produit par Global Dialogues (www.globaldialogues.org).
Facebook page: "Global Dialogues" -- please join us!
Global Dialogues: Established in 1997, Global Dialogues combines the creative genius of young people and the power of social change media to cultivate empathy, compassion and unity in diversity. We amplify youth voice in an innovative, intercreative program of social mobilization and global activism. Please join us in our efforts to envisage and create a healthier, more peaceful world.
The Global Dialogues films, based on stories submitted by creative youths in our contests, are crafted by leading filmmakers and emerging young talents. Available in numerous languages, the films reach over 200 million people every year.
Our vision: Global Dialogues envisions a healthy, peaceful world in which an empathetic and compassionate humanity flourishes in a spirit of equality and unity in diversity.
Global Dialogues' mission: To promote global public health and societal well-being through integrated, youth-driven solutions fueled by creativity and multidisciplinary partnership.
